channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024051619
item.description:
Report X-2024051619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-27
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found on trailer number 532993 already wet and leaking upon inspection 1 x 2.5-gallon pet clean laundry sanitizer plastic bag had a puncture allowing .25 gallon to release from shipment Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED THE CALL TO PICK UP A LEAKING HAZMAT. HE WAS WEARING PROPER PPE AND TOOK THE CLEAN-UP MATERIALS TO RESPOND TO SPILL. PACKAGE WAS ON FLOOR IN TRAILER NO SPILL OUTSIDE THE PKG. HE PUT LEAKER IN A SPILL TRAY AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024050784
item.description:
Report X-2024050784

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. ON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW ONE PACKAGE WITH A SMALL STAIN ON THE CORNER. UPON FUTHER INSPECTION, FOUND THAT THE BOTTLES WERE SHIPPED WITH VENTED CAPS INSIDE OF PLASTIC BAGS. THE VENTED CAPS CAUSED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT DAMAGING THE BOX
